intro: Solenophora, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Plumbaginaceae. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and are adapted to saline and sandy soils. They are characterized by their distinctive blue or purple flowers and silver-gray foliage. Solenophora species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their hardiness and aesthetic appeal. The plants have a fibrous root system and produce small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds.
